page.title: 15A Walk To Chewton Keynsham
page.content: On our walk to{Chewton Keynsham}we went through a lane starting at St. Clements Road.On either side were Holstein-Fresian(black and white)cows as well as crops such as barley and grassland.There was lots of rubble on the track and on the hill.All the houses in Chewton were made of stone. There were a few farms.One was unused except for the farm-house.We saw Manor Farm House and Manor Farm Cottage. Manor Farm House was a grand old place and Manor Farm Cottage was a small house with lots of flowers in the garden.We saw an old-fashioned post- box built in a wall.We stopped at Chewton Keynsham church.It had wrought -iron railings painted green.Then we retraced our steps a bit and turned right down a lane.Some of the lane was flooded because there had been lots of rain.We stopped at Chew bridge.
